website_summaries.verdict: Trumpet is a great buy for a beginner or a younger player.
pros: Includes a nice case and accessories
Great price for a beginner player
If you are looking for a unique finish, this horn also comes in several finish colors
cons: Some players have had problems with sticky valves, but this seems fixable with proper oiling

customer_reviews.title: Lousy instrument, good for a fountain.
customer_reviews.text: Crappy trumpet. Avoid at all costs. It’s better to buy a quality used student horn. On the plus side, we use the case for the student horn we bought, and I turned this trumpet into a fountain. Maybe I got my money’s worth?
customer_reviews.author: Lurchbird

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Band Students
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this trumpet! I bought two of them for my daughter and niece (both 11) who joined band this year. They both said they like these better than the Jupiter brand (really expensive) trumpets they were renting from the school's supplier. Lighter weight and plays beautifully. If you are shopping for a student, I HIGHLY recommend this trumpet! The case is very sturdy, too.
customer_reviews.author: Donna D

customer_reviews.title: It's cheap - but it works great.
customer_reviews.text: Well my son joined band for the first time last year, and I didn't want to drop a ton of cash on an expensive trumpet in the event that he decided to quit in the first few months, so I bought this one instead. It's already been a whole school year and he's had zero problems with it. For the price it cant be beat, glad I decided to give this a try.
customer_reviews.author: BrianAx

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your time. Valves stick, oil was clogged, can’t play a note if you do it’s super low and not right. Would return but past the return time by 11 days. Very disappointed 😔
customer_reviews.author: Stacy L Owens

customer_reviews.title: broke after 1 year of use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son to learn to play trumpet. 13 months after purchase (less than a year after use) the valve completely froze. It will cost me more to have it repaired than it is worth. Don't waste your money. Spend a little more and get something that will at least last more than a year.
customer_reviews.author: L. Dietz

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner trumpet
customer_reviews.text: This is a VERY good quality trumpet for a beginner. The case and accessories are top notch. It is light weight , but this was good for our grand daughter to handle. It has a nice tone and is easy to "tune" . I would definitely buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: P. Owen

customer_reviews.title: Get a King
customer_reviews.text: Don’t be tempted to buy this, because you will only end up wasting money. This is garbage. Keys stick despite proper maintenance and the sound quality is tinny and rough. Just not the same as a King or a Bach. Yes. They cost way more than this piece of tin can, but if your kiddo truly wants to learn the instrument, then find a used King to let them experience what a trumpet should feel and sound like. Just my opinion after living through this situation. Good luck.
customer_reviews.author: Thankful Grateful Blessed

customer_reviews.title: Great horn! Professionally recommended.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice trumpet! Especially for a cheap horn! Our band instructor is very picky and doesn't hesitate to rip apart other horns in front of the entire band if they do not meet his expectations. He sent this horn listing to all the parents in the band. As a suggestion. It plays well, with a nice warm tone. It is not blatty or too harsh sounding. And is well balanced in the hands. And it is beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Brand notorious for BAD VALVES
customer_reviews.text: Led astray by the better-than-deserved reviews, I purchased this student model trumpet for my 10 year old child. After less than 40 hours of instruction, one of the valves has become completely unusable, and another sticks often -- trumpet *has* been maintained, cleaned and lubricated regularly - yet no amount of lubrication will get the valve to function at this point. His teacher said this brand is notorious in this regard - really, really, really shoddy construction. Save yourself the hassle and buy another brand - if you buy this one, you'll have to buy another later anyway.
customer_reviews.author: RTW

customer_reviews.title: the trumpet is fine in the beginning but then after a while the ...
customer_reviews.text: the trumpet is fine in the beginning but then after a while the tuning slides rusted in and the trumpet started to turn green
customer_reviews.author: Angelo De Jesus

customer_reviews.title: Completely not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews, I was hopeful this would be a good solution for my son. However, after only three trumpet lessons, his teacher noticed a problem with the third valve. I now have to bring to a music store to have repaired. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Heather L’Homme

customer_reviews.title: Sticky keys
customer_reviews.text: Should have listened to poor reviews. I figured x amount of people would give poor rating but it will be ok product; I was wrong. The keys started sticking after day 1. Ugh
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: ... very first purchase from Amazon and by far the best purchased I've made
customer_reviews.text: My very first purchase from Amazon and by far the best purchased I've made. My son has been using this for marching band which ended about 6 months ago and still is using it. Knock on wood he still loves it, and it still works.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: cheap trumpets are a lot better than they used to be
customer_reviews.text: I've played trumpet for 10 years (on and off). This trumpet is really amazing for the price. Sound quality, durability, and design is really amazing for the price. I'd find it hard to imagine any band teacher saying it's a bad trumpet because it has all you need for someone starting out or in the intermediate phase like me.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Smith

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT DO IT
customer_reviews.text: This instrument is not fit to be used for students learning how to play for the first time. The kids band teacher advised us to return as the sound quality and overall quality of the instrument is of such poor quality "You're better off buying a used one off eBay".
customer_reviews.author: George Hursh

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for students
customer_reviews.text: The band teacher wouldn't let my son use this trumpet in class and he couldn't learn how to play any notes with it. We rented a Bach from the music store and could immediately tell a difference. After weeks of not being able to play a note on the Cecilio, my son was able to play a full scale after a day with the Bach TR300.
customer_reviews.author: TheThriftyHome

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a beginner!
customer_reviews.text: Let me be clear, I know nothing about instruments, I dont have the slightest idea of what my 6th grader speaks of when he comes home and shares his day about band practice.. so this is going to be the simplest review ever... Its absolutely perfect for your beginner in band! It comes ready to go, a nice case that is light and has extra storage for his workbook and other items he needs. I am beyond satisfied with this purchase that saved us 100's in rental costs for a different trumpet.
customer_reviews.author: N Juarez

customer_reviews.title: its a piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: yeah its cheap, but its not worth the difference in cost when it breaks - and it will break. manufacturer was helpful with warranty, but i have already gone through warranty once which was a pain and now its been a little over a year and it literally came apart - as in requires metal soldering..... its just not worth it if your player needs it to last any bit longer than a month. after over a year of dealing with this piece of junk, i bought a used GOOD one for $300 for my son who wont ever play outside of his school requirements. not to mention the neat "black" color - ha! it peels right off..........
customer_reviews.author: rangelar

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made valves
customer_reviews.text: This trumpet had good reviews so we bought it for my 12 year old for Christmas. She was so excited, but within weeks, we were having trouble with the valves sticking. Lubrication seemed to help at first, but now it won't move at all, and we realized that the valve body or valve slide (whatever it is called) is scored so the valve will no longer slide. It is totally worthless and it's only been 2 1/2 months since we bought it. We are thoroughly disappointed. Especially my daughter.
customer_reviews.author: K. F. J.

customer_reviews.title: Total junk
customer_reviews.text: Got one with valves stuck. Exchanged to another one, which stopped producing sounds after just 2 days or light use. True example of you get what you pay for. Wasted week+ of time (so kid couldn't practice between lessons) and now have to look for rental.
customer_reviews.author: Vale

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice, sounds good and great for students and beginners.
customer_reviews.text: I have received a dud and had to return the first one due to loose tone bar. Ordered another and seems ok but only had it for a week. Edit: After having the second one for over a month, been holding up well, it's been great so far with good sound and I would recommend these trumpets for students and beginners.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointing :(
customer_reviews.text: Awful. Bought this for my 16 year old son who wanted to branch out into a different brass instrument for Jazz Band this year. I didn't want to pay a lot for a new instrument (he has played French horn for the last 5 years... I wasn't sure he would like trumpet) and bought this based on other reviews. He thought the color was awesome and liked that it stood out, but the sound wasn't great and the keys stuck. He had his instructor try to get the keys in working order, but he could not. After much frustration, we returned this one and borrowed one from the school instead. Very disappointing :(
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Watson

customer_reviews.title: Starter trumpet for 10 y.o.
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical of the quality and Or durability of such an inexpensive instrument; however, was delighted! My 5th grader is trying band and not being sure if he would like it I wasn't going to go drop a big chunk of money on a fancier or more expensive instrument until I knew if he would play it and if he would like it.... And we are very happy with that I'm sure it will get him through this year and the next! His friends all love the cool sky blue color also! His first time playing it pictured below
customer_reviews.author: M.D.

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this based on reviews..... I should have known better. It is a giant piece of junk. Don’t waste your money. You can find nice quality used trumpets on eBay it at music stores. The sound is terrible, the mechanics are terrible..... bad purchase and wasted money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Okay for a beginner
customer_reviews.text: The sound of this horn is not too bad. It looks pretty and comes with everything you need. It doesn't play like my ole King but it has a decent sound, my biggest complaint is that the 1st key sticks consistently! Doesn't matter after cleaning, how much key oil is used it always sticks during play.
customer_reviews.author: AmyBeth T. BOTH

customer_reviews.title: ... tuba for almost 10 years now and decided I'd like to expand my talents
customer_reviews.text: I've played tuba for almost 10 years now and decided I'd like to expand my talents, and decided to pick up a cheap trumpet just for something to learn on. I'm pretty happy with it, it feels pretty sturdy, the finish looks nice, and the sound isn't bad. It's not a work of art, but it doesn't actually claim to be, so fair play. It's a perfectly acceptable learner's instrument
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Gafford

customer_reviews.title: Waste of MONEY
customer_reviews.text: Valves were wrong size and will cost over $100.00 to fix. Waste of MONEY!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Wagner

customer_reviews.title: This instrument was perfect for my child
customer_reviews.text: This instrument was perfect for my child. My only issue, is that the case doesn't allow for a lot of storage, especially for a mute. I had to cut into the inner styrofoam to create a place for the mute, but it worked out.
customer_reviews.author: Derrick C. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: ... ok for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is an ok instrument but not top quality at all. I received mine today and have notice a few things wrong with it with in ten minutes of playing. the Biggest is sticking of the vales. Not horrible sticking but they but they do not respond well even after oiling with valve oil. When i took out the valve there are still a very small amount of burr on it which leads me to believe that is the problem. For the price an ok horn. Maybe with a file or some braking in it will be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony thompsonshaw

customer_reviews.title: My wife is a professional trumpet player and she approves!
customer_reviews.text: We have tried other "discount" trumpets for my son and they were junk. This one has a very nice feel and build quality and looks very cool. The case is very nice as well. (much better than the $50 trumpet case we just bought for my wife actually) Both my wife and son LOVE the two tone color of silver and gold. Very happy guy here!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Trumpet!
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, seems to be well made with quality materials, fit and finish. Valves needed oil but work well. Valve 2 had lots of spring noise so I removed and disassembled the valve, the spring was not seated properly. Easy fix! Case is nice too. All in all a good trumpet at a great price. As a beginner it was a good alternative to buying an old beat up used trumpet of uncertain condition.
customer_reviews.author: York

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: I used to play trumpet back in my college days on a Bach Strad that I subsequently sold. Now, decades later, I decided to get back into playing trumpet and bought this one as a cheap way to re-start. I’m sorry I bought this trumpet and should have spent more on a better one. It’s OK for a beginner only but it’s hard to center notes. I’m not comparing it to my Strad—it is simply a very beginner’s trumpet. I’ll keep it until I get good again and then get rid of it and step up to something better.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Best Student Trumpet Money Can Buy
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews, good and bad. This trumpet may be the best you can buy at 5 times the price. I have owned professional trumpets and played a French Besson Meha all my life. Professionals who have horns costing $3000 to $20,000 (Monette's) might want one to take on vacation and leave their expensive horn home! One word of warning. When I received the instrument the valves were terrible. I thoroughly clean the valves and casings with a brush and soap and water. I then oiled with Yamaha Synthetic Oil and they are working just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Bolt

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive beginner trumpet
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my sixth grader starting beginner band. After figuring out the cost to rent this was a more cost effective option. So far it seems to have been a good investment. My son did complain that it wasn't as easy to get strong sound as other trumpets it takes more power but this may come in time.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina Kolpack

customer_reviews.title: We've ended Up switching them out because my son prefers this trumpet and the sound is better.
customer_reviews.text: Was nervous The quality of the sound wouldn't be there. I read reviews and it seemed mixed. My son has a much more expensive trumpet that he was playing and bought this one to have at home while his other one is at school. We've ended Up switching them out because my son prefers this trumpet and the sound is better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Replaces a Reynolds
customer_reviews.text: My kid is in his middle school band & used a 1965's Reynolds trumpet provided from school. At the end of the year, we had to return his school borrowed trumpet. So I explored both ebay & amazon to find a suitable replacememt for his summer practise. This trumpet stood out wrt price, availability & quality. So far this has stood the test of time. If things change in school year, I will update the review.
customer_reviews.author: Subash

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice, sounds cheap
customer_reviews.text: Son told us this trumpet sounds nothing like the ones the other kids play. We've found a different trumpet and told him this would be good enough for home practice. He hasn't used it since. Looks nice, sounds cheap
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: It's great!
customer_reviews.text: The trumpet's case seems very durable, i don't know, didn't get the chance to throw it around yet. The trumpet is very beautiful, no discoloration, or weird odors. It arrived in a soft fabric casing, coolio, I will reuse for my Flute Recorder. The valves were not sticky when the trumpet first arrived. The sound is really great, really smooth, and beautiful :') Which is so amazing for the price of $99. I've played with "professional" brand trumpets for the past 2 years, and this trumpet's sound is very similar to those that are "professional". Let's see how this goes once a year pasts.
customer_reviews.author: Jillian Borbe Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Unplayable- Valves Stick
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, this trumpet did not live up to the other reviews for us. The valves stick so badly that it's unplayable. We tried oil to no avail. Our local music repair shop has a list of brands they won't work on because of cheap construction and inferior metal used. Mendini was on their list.
customer_reviews.author: J. Carey

customer_reviews.title: This is a GREAT purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I am beyond my glory days of high school and college where I was an avid trumpeter. During those years, I played a top of the line Bach Stradivarius. That horn was sold to another up and coming band member. I still play in several bands, and wanted to get the trumpet involved somehow in any of those projects. I purchased this horn, it has an excellent sound, the valves work very nice. This is perfect for a beginner, however, it will also serve as a great horn for the veteran trumpet player.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Feltner

customer_reviews.title: Great Beginner Trumpet
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time we've bought one, and I am really happy with both of them. We first purchased one for my older son two years ago, and now our other child is playing trumpet too. These are well made and sound great- their music teachers are always surprised we bought instead of rented, but these are the smarter and more frugal way to go.
customer_reviews.author: The Gardner Mama

customer_reviews.title: Not a wise purchase,  faulty valves make for a disappointing performance.
customer_reviews.text: Played trumpet many years ago with a Bach strad and I'm getting back into my music. Purchased this as an alternative and I am very disappointed. You do get what you pay for. The trumpets finish is nice and clean, but the attention to the detail in manufacturing the valves is below subpar. Valves constantly stick even after thorough cleaning, inspection, and lubrication. If you want a pretty trumpet to hang on your wall for wall decor, this is it. Very frustrated with my overall playing experience with this trumpet due to the valves constantly sticking. Save yourself or your child the embarrassment of having malfunctioning equipment during practice or performances and avoid this brand.
customer_reviews.author: CP DESIGNSTop Contributor: Star Wars

customer_reviews.title: OK Trumpet for a beginner
customer_reviews.text: This trumpet is OK. It is fine for a young child starting out in band, it gets the job done and will meet requirements for a school band. That said, it arrived with one of the valve toppers missing (I found it in the case and was able to put it back on) which made me nervous that it was poorly made. If you're looking for a very basic, not super nice trumpet for a beginner, go for it!
customer_reviews.author: CO

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: First trumpet had two sticking valves. Why 5 Stars? Because within only a few hours of starting return, 2nd trumpet was packed, shipped, and on its way. This is Customer Service. 2nd trumpet works well. Nice for the price. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: William C. Sampson

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Did not know what to expect for this price. My son is 5th grade and I did not want to spend a lot of money if he was not going to stick with band. He showed the band directory and he was pleased with the product for the price. The only thing, was my son dropped it and the mouth piece got stuck. The repair shops here would look at it since it was an 'internet' brand. But we were able to fix it ourselves. Very satisfied with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Tammi

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for middle schooler
customer_reviews.text: I have a middle schooler who is yet to find his instrument of liking. He has moved from Violin, Harmonium, Drums, to Trumpt. I was looking for something of reasonable quality and not very costly. This trumpet fits the perfectly for both the choices. My son has been enjoying this thoroughly and his music teacher is also happy with the instrument so far. I recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Akhilesh Tiwari

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: I needed trumpets for 12 home school students to learn on. These were well affordable and sounded great for the price. These horns made our trumpet ensemble possible and well affordable. They aren't as sturdy as much more expensive horns would be but we make sure they are treated gently and slides greased and valves oiled often.
customer_reviews.author: James C.

customer_reviews.title: Sticky Valve, No Response from Tech Support
customer_reviews.text: Not long after we purchased the trumpet, we noticed that the valves are sticky. In other words, when the finger is released, the valve does not come up by itself. All the valves are a little sticky. But the middle one is extremely obvious. It is terrible and pretty much made the trumpet unusable. I opened the valve and noticed some uneven wear. Looks to me the valve was not straight to begin with, causing friction when it moves in the cylinder. I wrote an email to the manufacturer and got no response.
customer_reviews.author: Jianxun Dong

customer_reviews.title: Plays good and can’t beat the price
customer_reviews.text: My son has been using over a year. Plays good and can’t beat the price. In 4 months it payed for itself compared to renting from school. Original we bought just to try band, but we have gotten more than our money’s worth out of it. Considering buying exact same thing in a different finish when he starts marching band next year.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Valve Slow to Rise
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my daughter who is a fledgling trumpeter. She loves the look and the feel of the device but after taking it in to the band director and oiling the valves we're noticing that the first valve after being held down for a note sticks and then slowly rises back into the up position. Not sure what's going on there.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 11 year for school. Button sticks no matter how much oil was applied. Repair store didn’t want to fix it or couldn’t and the school was frustrated that my son didn’t have a working instrument. We were past the deadline to return.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle T.

customer_reviews.title: Great trumpet for a middle school student
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this trumpet for my son who is in band in his middle school. His teacher was shocked that we got such a good quality instrument on Amazon! This is a beautiful instrument with good quality sound. The case is great. This is a perfect instrument for a young learner.
customer_reviews.author: JKHale

customer_reviews.title: Great musical instrument for the price
customer_reviews.text: I'm no expert on trumpets. However we bought this for our grandson who is in a school band. He loves it my son who is in music business said that it's a pretty good trumpet overall. For the price I don't believe it can be beat. I have listened to my grandson play it in several of the school functions with the band. He and about five or six other students have played at the same time and as far as I'm concerned this trumpet sounds as good if not better than any of theirs.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hatcher

customer_reviews.title: Good instrument for 6th - 12th grade
customer_reviews.text: My son used this for 2 years in high school. Had no problems with it. The band director okayed the product before we purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: lasted less than 18 months
customer_reviews.text: Purple trumpet looked really cool when it arrived but started to fall apart after about 18 months. It was purchased it for an elementary school student, taking it back and forth to school, etc. The bell was dinged in the first few months but still worked ok. After about a year, the welds started to loosen and had to be super glued and duck taped back together. Looking for a new trumpet now because this one is unusable now.
customer_reviews.author: Eric P.

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: I've owned enough instruments to know what I was expecting this purchase to be and I was right. Beginners? Sure and mor these are fine instruments for anyone just wanting to play. If you buy a cheap product and expect to break records you're just not awake.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Very good value
customer_reviews.text: I had bought another lower cost Trumpet (Glory $118) for a beginner just before. While that one is OK for about $50 more this is a value and a better instrument. The Mendini instrument is solid. The valves work well. Sound is good. I had no issue playing across the range. The trumpet case is good. Plus the little extras: tuner, stand and value oil make it a excellent first instrument.
customer_reviews.author: Me-Myself-and-I

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed. My daughter was SO EXCITED to get this
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. My daughter was SO EXCITED to get this. It looks good, the case was nice.BUT, She is an experienced brass instrument player, but couldn't get this thing to make anything near "music". Problems with the valves sticking, airflow, and what little sound she was able to make was awful. I can't even say it was a toy to play with because you can't do anything with it. I really wish it lived up to the better reviews, but I guess I got one of the lemons. Read the other poor reviews... we had all the problems mentioned. Thanks goodness I bought from Amazon... it is going back.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bradshaw

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny!!
customer_reviews.text: My son is learning how to play the trumpet, and really loves this instrument. You really can't beat the price, especially for the ease of use, the sound quality, the beauty of it, and the protective case. We're very happy, and highly recommend it. This absolutely beats renting, and is an excellent choice for the novice to more advanced player!
customer_reviews.author: alnjoeysmom

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loves her Trumpet
customer_reviews.text: My daughter just started using her instrument, since School just started. So far no problems, and her teacher did not say anything about it not being the right fit for practice. My daughter says she loves it very much.
customer_reviews.author: cholly

customer_reviews.title: Great for Beginners
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this trumpet as a Christmas gift for our 6th grader. She absolutely loves this instrument and carries with pride. She loves the color (silver) and the weight of it. We are reluctant to purchase and/or lease a trumpet from one of the instrument stores until we were confident that this was something that she was going to stick with. The price that we paid for this was awesome and we don't have to turn it back in. At the $109 cost, we can replace it cheaper than to repair the leased one. I would purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing deal! I was so surprised at the quality of this instrument for the price. Even the case is sturdy and well made. Plays beautifully. I would highly suggest this trumpet for anyone who has a student just starting out in band.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Good looking trumpet, seems well made, no flaws in the finish at all. The deep purple color is quite nice. The valve action and slides all function properly for the most part. Valve 1 sticks slightly because the valve stem is a bit off center but I think that I can make it work with some sandpaper to smooth the stem where it rubs the cap. Not worth sending it back. This may be why it was a warehouse deal.
customer_reviews.author: York

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the sound and it plays well. Little glitch with an inlay missing but they were fast about shipping replacements. Customer service is excellent and so is the trumpet.
customer_reviews.author: SONIC

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality and Sound!!
customer_reviews.text: Suprised at the quality of the instrument, considering the price!! Great buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Capps

customer_reviews.title: This works great and was a great value
customer_reviews.text: My kid's a beginner. This works great and was a great value.
customer_reviews.author: beans_mama

customer_reviews.title: Thoroughly enjoying my beautiful muse
customer_reviews.text: Thoroughly enjoying my beautiful muse! This horn makes me want to play every song I love and know. I’m even inspired to improve and work my way to open mic/jam sessions.
customer_reviews.author: xxEAGLEWOLFxx

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner Trumpet
customer_reviews.text: Sounds great. The kit is great. The quality of the product is good enough for his 2nd year of band. The instructor inspected it and listened to the sound quality and gave it a passing grade. At $100 it beat paying $40 a month in band fees. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Mike90

customer_reviews.title: Great instrument for those that don't want to spend an ...
customer_reviews.text: Great instrument for those that don't want to spend an arm and a leg. My son has had his first one for about 6 years. We just bought him the same one again. I'll take 6 years of playing on this inexpensive instrument any day.
customer_reviews.author: drew

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price . Beats paying for a rental for a child, or anyone, to assess their own interest. Appears well made,solid constrxn ,smooth action, nice finish.
customer_reviews.author: Major Dude

customer_reviews.title: Tried to blow a note, could only get air.
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t work could not get this trumpet to blow a note. I tried tuning the valves, and snaking for a blockage, still would not make sound.
customer_reviews.author: jamon powell

customer_reviews.title: Honestly, I'm shocked
customer_reviews.text: Sounds great, good feel. Well made. I used to play trumpet, got this for my kiddo who is learning. It sounds lovely. Totally recommend, wish they had an inexpensive option like this when I was a kid.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: It does the job. Though even with regular cleaning/lube ...
customer_reviews.text: It does the job. Though even with regular cleaning/lube it tends to stick a bit more than it should.
customer_reviews.author: Todd A Candelaria

customer_reviews.title: Trumpet sounds good. Doesn't stick as long as it's oiled properly
customer_reviews.text: Trumpet sounds good. Doesn't stick as long as it's oiled properly. I'm pretty disappointed that the blue lacquer is flaking off in multiple places. Started about 2 months after getting the trumpet. Lacquer is very poorly done.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Will Update After Daughter Receives as Gift
customer_reviews.text: It’s absolutely beautiful out of the box. Comes with cleaning cloth, gloves, an owner’s manual sheet, and valve oil. Carrying case is very nice and sturdy! Only thing is the front pocket zipper was messed up but I zipped and re-zipped and all was fine. The real test will be when my daughter tries it out on Christmas! I can’t wait! I think she’ll love it!
customer_reviews.author: Becky Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Color and Sound!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome trumpet! I bought this for my niece who is 6 years old. It is a beautiful deep purple and has an amazing sound. Everything in the sturdy black carrying case was neatly arranged (trumpet, 7C mouthpiece, valve oil, gloves and polishing cloth). You will not be disappointed with this trumpet. Outstanding customer service too!
customer_reviews.author: D. Herrera

customer_reviews.title: Great trumpet for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great kids first trumpet. Everything works well including the slide. Excellent instrument for the price. If he stays with it I'll buy him a better trumpet in the future after he gets over the dent and scratch phase. Mouthpiece is perfect for a 10 year old, a little small for me.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great for my beginner! This is his second year using it and no problems yet!
customer_reviews.author: richking13

customer_reviews.title: Although it wasn't what the school band director recommended, it did the job perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son as a beginner's intrument. I didn't want to spend much money in case he didn't stick with it. Although it wasn't what the school band director recommended, it did the job perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Generic

customer_reviews.title: Good trumpet, being used by beginning 9yo.
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box 1 valve did stick a bit. Cleaned and oiled the valves and no problems since christmas. My 9 yo has been taking lessons; no issues. Had the tutor play it and it sounds good. My niece's band teacher checked it out as a second opinion, he said it sounded good. Thought we were joking about the price. Over all everything is good so far. May update at year mark.
customer_reviews.author: Gman

customer_reviews.title: My son loves this trumpet
customer_reviews.text: My son simply loves this trumpet. It is amazing for beginners. I am happy I bought it because when I went to the music store they wanted to sell me one for $600. so if you are just starting out, buy this trumpet.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: My son is learning
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son for his 4th grade music class. The first few nights of his practice I wanted to move out 😃. Now he is getting good at it and it’s a delight to hear him practice.
customer_reviews.author: An

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly great!
customer_reviews.text: This horn has surprisingly good sound. You can definitely feel that it has thinner metal, but this sound is quite pleasant. I actually bought a second one for my kids. Due to how these are priced, I really don’t have to worry about it. It’s great!
customer_reviews.author: J. Perkins

customer_reviews.title: This is a terrific product and will hold up to the abuses of ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 11 year old and school. The school will let you rent items but for this price it just made sense to purchase one. This is a terrific product and will hold up to the abuses of pre-teens.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Soronen

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: Received first trumpet in used condition with dent and leaking oil bottle. Only reason I knew it was used because the oil bottle was already opened. So another two day to order a replacement and send it back and I finally received one in good condition. Quality seems to be good. We will see how it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Wisneaky

customer_reviews.title: Nice trumpet
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my great grandson for early Christmas present. He really liked it. More importantly his band director likes it and says it's a great trumpet for him.
customer_reviews.author: Walter P

customer_reviews.title: This is a huge step down from the bach stradivarious ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a huge step down from the bach stradivarious I had in high school and the quality is questionable in some senses. But for the price, I have no regrets.
customer_reviews.author: RandomGuy

customer_reviews.title: Great deal !!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 12 year old sons first year in band. Have not been let down at all. He has done well with it and is learning daily with it. Looks nice and sounds great. Worth every penny so far.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy C.

customer_reviews.title: Great backup
customer_reviews.text: I was told my kids can't use this brand for class but if you ask me it sounds as good as the ones they rent for 10 times the cost. Beautiful instrument and nice case. My son enjoys playing this more than the one we rent. It has a great sound.
customer_reviews.author: momof3

customer_reviews.title: Best Value for School Band Student
customer_reviews.text: This trumpet is perfect for any school band member. It looks very nice; feels like a quality build, and performs better than the one we rented before. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Wood

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: My son started playing trumpet at school. The rental price was for that instrument was going to be like $1,200. This one was a way better buy and sounds better than the one we had rented.
customer_reviews.author: William Brimer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Second year of use in middle school band for my son with no problems so far. I highly recommend this trumpet for a beginner trumpet player. I will buy another instrument from this seller whenever my other kid enters middle school and decide what instrument he wants. Thanks a million.
customer_reviews.author: System7

customer_reviews.title: Perfect starter trumpet
customer_reviews.text: Great beginner band instrument! I paid hundreds more for my other son trumpet when he started band. The band instructor was totally impressed with the quality of this instrument for the money. The carry case is great too, very compact, light and easy to carry.
customer_reviews.author: mom23

customer_reviews.title: Great find...
customer_reviews.text: Works great, like any mechanical thing, you need to maintain, and my skills are growing on this one alone. Cant be more happy, even my kids are learning and I might get some for them once I can afford it
customer_reviews.author: Manny Olivo

customer_reviews.title: Well priced beginners trumpet
customer_reviews.text: I was a little concerned reading some of the reviews from teachers criticizing the quality of the instrument. But I was in a time crunch and hoped for the best. We have had no complaints from our elementary schooler's teacher about this instrument. It plays perfectly well and is turning out to be a great beginners trumpet.
customer_reviews.author: Nic.S

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Quality for a good price.
customer_reviews.text: This is me playing after 6 years without a trumpet. I am so happy I bought this!!! I 100% love this!! The Paint is amazing! The Sound is awesome! And all the buttons press smoothly!! It came with gloves, a microfiber rag, and some Valve oil! And a Decent amount of it at that! The case is light but nice, it can also roll or be turned into a backpack using the straps that were also included. I would recommend this to and for any beginner player!!!
customer_reviews.author: robin elizabeth danielle fowler

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: This trumpet is really good. It has pretty good sound quality and my son feels awesome having a blue one. The school wanted to charge about the same amount for renting one, so I'm glad we bought this one instead. Totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Nay Zuniga

customer_reviews.title: The color is nice. We don't know how good the sounds quality ...
customer_reviews.text: My 10-year-old new musician LOVES his new trumpet! The color is nice. We don't know how good the sounds quality is as you can imagine with a newbie! Hahah. But the instrument looks great ;)
customer_reviews.author: amie979

customer_reviews.title: good to start up trumpet again
customer_reviews.text: I haven't played for a decade, so I knew I wanted to start again with the basics - including a basic trumpet. Good value for the price, it plays! Sounds okay, valves don't get too sticky, is good for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Paloma

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: Valves are numbered on a trumpet from 1-3. Rather than get one of each which is what was needed, our trumpet had no third valve and two first valves. This prevented the air to go through properly. You could give yourself an aneurism trying to blow through it, to no avail. Returned and bought the kaizer trumpet.
customer_reviews.author: Nurth Gabriela

product_meta.title: Mendini by Cecilio Sky Blue Trumpet Brass Standard Bb Trumpet, Student Beginner with Hard Case, Gloves, 7C Mouthpiece, and Valve Oil
product_meta.description: Color:Sky BlueMendini by Cecilio trumpets are ideal for beginner or student musicians. This trumpet features a phosphorus copper lead mouth pipe, topped with 3 comfortable white mother of pearl key inlaid and 3 smooth action valves. Every trumpet is play tested at Cecilio’s factory and re-tested at their Los Angeles distribution center to ensure that their high quality standards are met. This is why thousands of instructors have approved these trumpets. This trumpet package includes a plush-lined nylon covered hard shell case, a pair of gloves, a soft cleaning cloth, and a bottle of valve oil. Buy with confidence as it comes with a 1- year warranty against any manufacturer's defects.
feature_bullets: Bb (B flat) trumpet, Beautiful and durable brass body, Phosphorus copper used on lead (not the metal lead, but leading up to...) mouth pipe, smooth action valves, & comfortable buttons
Medium-large .460 inch bore with 5 inch bell, 1st valve slide thumb saddle, adjustable 3rd slide lock

Includes: Pro-Deluxe durable plush lined nylon covered hard case with backpack straps and zipper pocket, Silver plated 7C mouthpiece, Soft polishing cloth, a pair of white gloves, and a bottle of valve oil

Each instrument is tested at Cecilio's factory overseas and again in their local warehouse in Southern California. It comes with a 1-year warranty against manufacturer’s defects and serviced locally. Contact us by message or call our support team.

1-Year Warranty: Each instrument is tested at Cecilio's factory overseas and are tested again in their local warehouse in Southern California. Each instrument comes with a 1-year warranty against manufacturer’s defects and are serviced locally. If you have any questions, feel free to reach us by message or our toll free number to contact our support team.
